speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in a prison.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Enter, severally, DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as a friar, and Provost

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Hail to you, provost! so I think you are.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I am the provost. What's your will, good friar?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Bound by my charity and my blest order,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I come to visit the afflicted spirits

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Here in the prison. Do me the common right

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To let me see them and to make me know

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: The nature of their crimes, that I may minister

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To them accordingly.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I would do more than that, if more were needful.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Enter JULIET

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Look, here comes one: a gentlewoman of mine,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Who, falling in the flaws of her own youth,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Hath blister'd her report: she is with child;

speaker: Provost
text_entry: And he that got it, sentenced; a young man

speaker: Provost
text_entry: More fit to do another such offence

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Than die for this.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: When must he die?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: As I do think, to-morrow.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I have provided for you: stay awhile,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: To JULIET

speaker: Provost
text_entry: And you shall be conducted.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Repent you, fair one, of the sin you carry?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I do; and bear the shame most patiently.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I'll teach you how you shall arraign your conscience,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And try your penitence, if it be sound,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Or hollowly put on.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I'll gladly learn.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Love you the man that wrong'd you?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Yes, as I love the woman that wrong'd him.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: So then it seems your most offenceful act

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Was mutually committed?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Mutually.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Then was your sin of heavier kind than his.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I do confess it, and repent it, father.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: 'Tis meet so, daughter: but lest you do repent,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: As that the sin hath brought you to this shame,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Which sorrow is always towards ourselves, not heaven,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Showing we would not spare heaven as we love it,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: But as we stand in fear,--

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I do repent me, as it is an evil,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And take the shame with joy.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: There rest.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Your partner, as I hear, must die to-morrow,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And I am going with instruction to him.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Grace go with you, Benedicite!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Must die to-morrow! O injurious love,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: That respites me a life, whose very comfort

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Is still a dying horror!

speaker: Provost
text_entry: 'Tis pity of him.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Exeunt
